O1.summary: Get New Parts for the Radiators

description.S1: You need to get new parts for the Radiator Array to keep the Groundbreaker from overheating.
description.S2: Junlei wants you to salvage the parts for the radiators from old machinery in the back bays.

blurb.B1: Travel to the Back Bays using the elevator directly opposite Engineering.
blurb.B3: the Stranger will be confronted by Captain MacRedd,
blurb.B4: a crazed outlaw leader and self-proclaimed "king".
blurb.B6: each of which will allow the Stranger to pass through the Back Bays and retrieve the parts:
blurb.B7: Attack and kill MacRedd and his outlaws.
blurb.B8: With Persuade 40 or Intimidate 40, MacRedd will ask for tribute in exchange for the parts.
blurb.B9: Lie 40 can be used to lie about the parts leaking deadly toxins,
blurb.B10: or he can be bribed with 630 bits.
blurb.B11: With Felix in your party MacRedd will only need to be bribed.
blurb.B12: The spare parts are located on the upper level of the Back Bays.

O2.summary: Talk to Junlei about the Parts

description.S1: Go talk to Junlei to figure out what to do with the radiator parts you found.

blurb.B1: Return to Junlei to move on to the next step of repairing the radiators.
blurb.B2: Junlei asks the Stranger to take the elevator at the back of Engineering down to the machinery shaft and activate the terminal they find there.
blurb.B3: She warns them of a mantipillar infestation and advises that they go armed.

dialog.speaker: CaptainMacRedd (Male)
dialog.utterance: Look at this ripe piece of meat just sizzling on the grill. Yum yum.

dialog.speaker: CaptainMacRedd (Male)
dialog.utterance: Time to feed the flames. It's nothing personal. Promise.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Put that down before you incinerate the entire deck.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You're only getting out of this alive if you play nice.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I was just exploring the ship and stumbled on this level.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: If it's nothing personal, I'll just be going.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Attack> Neither is this.

dialog.speaker: CaptainMacRedd (Male)
dialog.utterance: I know this ain't a toy, neighbor from above. It's a catalyst, just like me. Keep talking. I like the sound of your voice.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm here for some parts. Junlei sent me.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm just passing through. Can I go?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Attack> I was just distracting you. Nothing personal.

dialog.speaker: CaptainMacRedd (Male)
dialog.utterance: Tennyson just keeps feeding the furnace, don't she? We're still playing with her last sacrifice out back, with the crew.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: So can I grab that part, then?

dialog.speaker: CaptainMacRedd (Male)
dialog.utterance: You don't just ask a king for a favor when you're standing in his court. You bring tribute. Sacrifices. Prophecy. Shit like that.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Fine, here's <oeiglobal>Bribe_Amount</oeiglobal> bits.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Those parts are leaking deadly toxins. I'll just come back after you're dead.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: <Attack> How about I just kill you and take the parts?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll be right back after I scrounge together some tribute.

dialog.speaker: CaptainMacRedd (Male)
dialog.utterance: Tribute it is, and ain't this just a royal sum.

dialog.speaker: CaptainMacRedd (Male)
dialog.utterance: You've got the run of the kingdom. Up those stairs you'll find the parts. My crew won't get in your way.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: There was something else.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Got it. Thanks, MacRedd.

dialog.speaker: CaptainMacRedd (Male)
dialog.utterance: Lay it on me, boss. I'm good for it.

dialog.speaker: CaptainMacRedd (Male)
dialog.utterance: Neighbor from above. What brings you to my little moonlight kingdom?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: How did you end up back here?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Be seeing you.

dialog.speaker: CaptainMacRedd (Male)
dialog.utterance: Ship got impounded. The crew and I racked up a debt while we were grounded, and my baby got sold to SubLight. Scrapped for parts.

dialog.speaker: CaptainMacRedd (Male)
dialog.utterance: That's bureaucracy for you. Piracy with a smile.

dialog.speaker: CaptainMacRedd (Male)
dialog.utterance: That's bureaucracy for you. Piracy with a smile.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Sounds a lot like what happened to me.

dialog.speaker: CaptainMacRedd (Male)
dialog.utterance: Am I your dark reflection? Shit. Must be getting old. Stay here too long and the Groundbreaker drains you like a fuel tank.

dialog.speaker: CaptainMacRedd (Male)
dialog.utterance: Under its skin, this ship is all poison and darkness. Lead bones, asbestos muscle. Maybe you're right.

dialog.speaker: CaptainMacRedd (Male)
dialog.utterance: Passing through? This is dead end territory. But you talk like you're on a journey. The path matches your step. Stretches out ahead of you. Yeah...

dialog.speaker: CaptainMacRedd (Male)
dialog.utterance: Look at the courage on this one! Lay it on me, boss. Give me a taste of that fiery, primal spirit.

dialog.speaker: CaptainMacRedd (Male)
dialog.utterance: You stumbled into my court without an invitation, neighbor from above. If you don't have any business, then it's time to light up the grill.

dialog.speaker: CaptainMacRedd (Male)
dialog.utterance: No one turns their back on me while I'm holding court. Get him, boys!
